title: How to Paint Appliances

steps.headline: Cover the floor and surrounding area with a drop cloth.
steps.description: This will protect flooring and any other appliances and furniture from paint. Put the appliance on top of the drop cloth.

steps.headline: Clean the appliance.
steps.description: Use a sponge to wipe the appliance down with soap and water. Scrape off any dried debris or particles. All grease and oil substances must be completely removed. Dry the appliance with a clean towel.

steps.headline: Rub the appliance with an ammonia based solution.
steps.description: Mix a small solution of ammonia and water together and sponge it all over the appliance. This will give it an easier finish to prepare and paint.

steps.headline: Rub the appliance with a scouring pad.
steps.description: Use a steel wool or something with strong, solid bristles that can scour the appliance for stubborn contaminants or food and debris left crusted to the appliance.

steps.headline: Sand the appliance.
steps.description: Rub a coarse sandpaper all over the appliance, including handles and ledges. Dust away the debris with a clean paintbrush and sand the entire appliance a second time. Sanding it thoroughly is necessary for the paint to adhere to the appliance surface.

steps.headline: Remove hardware.
steps.description: Any knobs or buttons that will not be painted, or can be painted separately should be removed from the appliance.

steps.headline: Apply tape to spots that will not be painted.
steps.description: Any clocks, words, or other markings and areas on the appliance that will not be painted over should be covered with painter's tape.

steps.headline: Purchase appliance paint.
steps.description: Self priming epoxy appliance paint is available at home improvement and hardware stores. This type of paint is available in a can to be painted with a brush, or in a spray can.

steps.headline: Paint the appliance.
steps.description: Use slow, even strokes to put one full coat on the entire appliance if using a paint brush. If using the spray painting method, hold the can a consistent distance from the appliance and cover it with a complete coat. Allow the appliance to dry overnight.

steps.headline: Apply a second coat of paint to the appliance.
steps.description: A second coat will give the appliance an even, smooth painted finish. Allow the appliance to dry.
